conclusion: Points M and N form an equilateral triangle with point B, with each side of length L.
The charges at M and N are +Q and -Q respectively.
The small ball with charge +q is at point B.
The electric field due to a point charge Q at a distance r is given by E = kQ/r^2.
At point B, the distances to charges at M and N are both L.
Electric field due to +Q at M is E_M = kQ/L^2.
Electric field due to -Q at N is E_N = kQ/L^2.
Since M and N form an equilateral triangle with B, the angle between the lines BM and BN is 60 degrees.
The components of E_M and E_N along the line connecting M and N cancel each other out due to symmetry.
The perpendicular components add up to E_net = E_M sin(60) + E_N sin(60).
The electric force F on the ball with charge +q is F = qE_net.
